text: Barwa bursztynowa. Piana niska, drobno pÄ™cherzykowata. W aromacie beczka dÄ™bowa, ciemne owoce, karmel, delikatna wanilia. W smaku podobnie jak w aromacie. Piwo gÅ‚adkie i peÅ‚ne. Alkohol dobrze uÅ‚oÅ¼ony.

Bottle - Raisin, cherry, oak and some dark fruits. Clearish copper with a small beige head. Lots d plum, prune and dark fruit but I donÂ’t really get a significant cherry note. Still a great and rich beer though.
Bottle. Aroma of oak, acacia, raisin and boozy caramel. Taste has booze, oak, mild red fruit, soft vanilla, creamy caramel and ripe fruit. Good stuff.

Bottled. Pours clear amber with a small off-white head. Aroma of toasted caramel, dried fruit, banana notes, vanilla and wood. sweet flavor that ends up being more dry. Medium bodied, oily textured and soft carbonated. A very nice Quad indeed. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

Bottle 375ml. corked. @ Bierproeflokaal In De Wildeman, Kolksteeg 3, Amsterdam, Netherlands 1012 PT. [ As La Trappe Quadrupel Oak Aged Batch #24 ].[ Courtesy of Local DÃ˜E member Holstebro ]. Unclear medium orange amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, vanilla, wood, oak, moderate yeasty, sweet yeast, fruity yeast, dried fruit, riped fruit, almond - strawberry - mango notes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with a long duration, dried fruit, vanilla, sweet yeast, fruity yeast, light wood - oak, banana - almond - strawberry notes. Body is medium, texture is oily - creamy, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20160903]
 8-4-8-3-15

Corked bottle. Dark amber color. Malt, white wine and a hint of oak in the aroma. Malty sweet vinous flavor with vanilla and white wine. Kirsch-schnaps? DidnÂ’t taste any. A slight tartness. Very nice.

Amber kleurig bier met een aroma van zoete kersen, banaan en karamel.
In de smaak proef je zoete kersen, banaan, karamel, vanille en uiteraard eikenhout. Alcohol proef je bijna niet, daar is La Trappe altijd erg goed in.
In de afdronk komt de vanille vooral opspelen samen met het eikenhout.

17.12.2016, 0,375l bottle @ home:
Big fizzy-creamy longlasting head, nice red-amber color. Aroma is mild yeasty, oak, yeast, minerals, candi sugar, grass, dried fruits, banana, fruit stones, light malts, almonds, caramel. Taste is slightly dry mineraly, weeds, oak, minerals, candi sugar, yeast, grass, dried fruits, alcohol, fruit stones, almonds, light malts, hay. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mineraly mouthfeel. Nice.

Bottle shared during the November THT tasting at deansoÂ’s place. Pours a clear amber with a white head. Lots of caramel, grainy, sweet malts, oak, dark fruits, vanilla. Has a sort of nutty thing to it. Flavor is over medium sweet, light bitter.
Bottle shared at the November THT at deansoÂ’s place. Clear caramel pour with a thin off-white head. Notes of sherry, dried fruit, overripe fruit, whiskey and caramel.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2016 Bottle (from het biermoment). Pours dark amber with beige head. The head stays. Aroma is very sweet, malty, sugar, dark fruitsm cherries. Flavor is sweet and bitter, sugar, malt, caramel, fruits, booze, spices, cherries. Finish is sweet, spices, and booze. Overall: very good brew, but not on bar with the better versions of this beer, just too sweet and too boozy.
Sampled from bottle at "This is not really deansoÂ’s last THT"-tasting. Hazy amber with white head. Sweet fruity and chestnut. Medium sweet. Medium body. Soft carbonation.

Bottle at almost DeanÂ’s final tasting, but weÂ’ll call it his final tasting anyway. Pours a clear amber beer, just like all the other versions. Aroma of light vinous notes, loads of oak. Flavor is a bit thin, oaky, syrupy and hints of booze. Quite syrupy. Low in carbonation. Quite nice though.

37.5bottle shared at THT November.
Thin white head. Hazy golden pour. Very good
Bottle shared. Very hazy brown with a tan head. Aroma of caramel, oak, vanilla and light overripe dark fruits. A little subdued. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet. Full bodied with soft carbonation.
Bottle from nutjes. Many thanks! Amber colour, beige foam. Sweet nose of banana, wood, cherry liquor. Very subtle and well balanced variant of the quadrupel. I like it.

37,5cl-fles op tasting bij Elie. Merci! U: Wazig koperkleurig met beige schuimkraag. G: Kersen, karamel en ook wat banaan. Zeer fruitig. S: Kersen en karamel mooi met elkaar verweven. Zoet bier met zeer licht bittertje. M: Volmondig met een stevige carbonatie

0.375 l bottle from the monastery. Bottle was shared. Apperance: A Clear, dark ruby with a medium sized, frothy,, off-white head. Aroma: Sweetish, maltt,
caramel, raisins, marizpan, some cherries,oak, almond, vanilla and a bit of cinnamon.Taste: Sweet, caramel malts raisins, marzipan, cherries, prunes, some oak and almond, followed by a medium long, moderately bitter, slightly yeasty-spicy finish, with a sourish touch were the oak and cherries return.. 
Medium to full body, slightly creamy and soft carbonation.

Brown with a beige head. Aroma is cherries, dates, raisins, hint of sweet spices. Full bodied, lightly sticky mouthfeel, sweet and lightly boozy on the palate with a long sticky finish. Taste is cherry brandy, dates, raisins, spices.

37.5 cl bottle, thanks to Benzai. Pours clear and golden deep brown with an off white head. Aroma is roasted caramelish, overripe fruit. Raisins and plums. Phenolic spiced. Mellow. Persisting overripe fruity. Dry phenolic. Subdued sweetness. Dry phenolic and slight warming alcohol far finish.

375-m bottle from wlvliquors. huge head, lasting, intoxicating aromatic sweet nose, sweet wood, toffee, banana, medium body, delightful, maybe the best so far, wished i had another #8 to have with it.

Donker amberkleurig bier met witte schuimkraag. Geur: iets te koud geserveerd. peren, wat kersenpitten. Na wat opwarmen: zoeter en meer kersengeur. Smaak: stroperig, likeur, kersen, overrijp fruit. Redelijk volmondig. Matige koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: zoet, kersenlikeur.

375ml bottle at home. Dark mahogany with a small slightly off-white head. Full complex body with low carbonation. Quite sweet with subtle bitter tones. Caramel, malts, subtle ripe cherries, oak, some vanilla and raisin. Good!
Na de geweldige batch 23 moet ik zeggen dat deze oak aged toch wel tegen valt. Het blijft een mooie quadrupel maar voor dit geld kun je veel beter krijgen.
UPDATED: JUL 8, 2016 Oranje donker bier met een goede witte schuim kraag. Ruikt overrijp fruit, kaas, rood fruit. Smaakt naar kersen, overrijp fruit, vanille, rood fruit. Beetje alcohol.
Ruikt naar een blauwadderkaas. Vind ik dus lekker. Smaakt pittig, kazig, heel grappig voor een bier.
UPDATED: JUL 8, 2016 Mooie bruine kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt herfstfruit, crÃ¨me, houtig. Smaakt vol vanille, kers, herfstfruit, kruiden.

Bottle thx to Benzai, medium sample. Slight hazy golden to amber color, short frothy head. Aroma of caranel, toffee, slight raisin, bit fruity, slight oak wood. Bit sweet in taste. Barrels give some more complexity to the base beer, which is clearly present still. Good one, but not the best of the bunch.

Bottle shared with Caesar @ Caesars mancave. Clear red to red-brown color, average sized off-white head. Aroma is lightly malts, sweet. Taste malts, sweet. Hmm to be honest this is probably the BA Quad that has the least additional flavor to the regular la trappe quadrupel. Hmm IÂ’m a bit disappointed. Meh.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2016 0.375 l bottle from the monastery. Clear, dark ruby with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, off-white head. Sweetish, malty and slightly fruity aroma of caramel, raisins, some cherries, marzipan, almond, cinnamon and a touch of oak. Sweet, malty and slightly fruity taste of caramel, raisins, marzipan, cherries, prunes, some oak and almond, followed by a medium long, moderately bitter, slightly yeasty-spicy finish with a sourish touch. Medium to full body, slightly creamy and a little effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Good!
In het proeflokaal bij de brouwerij Bijzonder fraaie en smaakvolle quad Twee flessen in de winkel gescoord
